description: While driving on the highway, my car was involved in a collision. The impact caused shattered glass from the windshield, resulting in my spouse suffering a total and irrecoverable loss of sight in one eye. Is there a provision for compensation specifically for my spouse's injury under the policy limits?

sources.paragraph: If: - you or your spouse are injured solely as a result of an accident involving your car; or while travelling in or getting into or out of your car; or - any other person is injured -while travelling in or getting into or out of your car; we will pay you or your legal representatives or if you ask us to, the person injured or their legal representative the compensation specified below: Provided that death or loss occurs within three calendar months and solely and directly as a result of the accident.

You are not covered for the following: - any person who, at the time of the injury, has not reached their sixteenth birthday; - in respect of death or injury as a result of suicide, attempted suicide or any intentional self-injury.

LOSS.description: Total and irrecoverable loss of sight in one or both eye

limit_targets: Other members of your  household normally living with him

description: I discovered someone had attempted to steal the child car seats from my vehicle. In the process, the thief damaged the car door. Could I be compensated for items damaged or lost during this incident?

sources.paragraph: If your car is fitted with any child car seats, we will pay up to 300 for their replacement with the same or similar model following an accident covered by this policy. We will pay for the replacement whether or not visible damage has been caused to the child car seat.
Providing you report the loss to the police within 24 hours of discovering the loss.You should purchase the replacement seat and we will reimburse you on presentation of the receipt.

LOSS.description: Damage to car or spare parts

INDEMNITY.description: Replace what is lost or damaged

description: I parked my new car, less than a year old, at the mall. When I returned, it was gone. The police located it later, but it had been set on fire. The damage was extensive, but the repair costs were less than 60% of the car's value. Could the policy provide support for transportation or accommodation during this ordeal?

sources.paragraph: If during the period of one year after the first registration as new your car is: - stolen and not recovered; or - damaged so that repairs will cost more than 60% of the manufacturers price list (including taxes and the cost of accessories) at the time of the loss or damage; and provided your car is owned by you then we will replace your car with a new one of the same make, model and specification. Provided that: - one is available - you and anyone else we know who has a financial interest in your car agree.

If your car is recovered before a new replacement is ordered and the cost of repairs are less than 60% of the manufacturers list price, we will do one of the following: - repair the damage - replace what is lost or damaged beyond economical repair or n pay you cash for the amount of the loss or damage.
You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. An example of an acceptable precaution is to attend the test drive with the prospective buyer. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.

LOSS.description: Theft with recovery and  costing less than 60% of new car to repair

INDEMNITY.description: Repair the damage - by not approved repairer

SERVICE.description: Overnight accommodation, including the cost of meals and drinks, for the driver and passengers of your car

description: The fire started in the trunk where I had stored several car accessories, including a portable tire inflator and a set of jumper cables. The flames spread quickly, damaging the rear bumper and taillights. Could the damage to the rear bumper and taillights be considered under the policy's specific limits for glass-related incidents?

sources.paragraph: If your car, accessories or spare parts are lost, stolen or damaged, we will: - repair the damage; - replace what is lost or damaged and is too expensive to repair; or - pay you the cost of the loss or damage.

If your car is damaged, we will use one of our recommended repairers to repair it. If you choose not to use them, we may not pay more than our recommended repairer would have charged and we may choose to settle the claim by a financial payment. Following damage to your car, we may move your car to a place of safe and free storage pending settlement of any claim.

Where your car is not recovered following a theft or is beyond economical repair we will pay you the market value of your car, including accessories and spare parts at the time they are lost, stolen or damaged.
If we settle a claim as a total loss, we will then take ownership of your car.
Accessories and spare parts of your car, which are in your private garage at the time of their loss or damage, will also be covered.
You are not covered for the following:
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.

LOSS.description: Damage to car or spare parts

INDEMNITY.description: Replace what is lost or damaged

SERVICE.description: Public transport for the driver and the passengers of your car to return to your home or your original planned destination.

description: While towing a trailer, I was involved in an incident where the trailer detached and collided with another vehicle. A passenger in my car, who was exiting at the time, required emergency medical treatment as mandated by the Road Traffic Act. Is there coverage available for the medical expenses incurred by my passenger?

sources.paragraph: This policy covers you for the amounts shown below: a Death of or injury to any person unlimited. b Damage to any other persons property up to 20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed 25,000,000 which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any persons property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car. The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.
We will pay for any emergency medical treatment that must be provided under the Road Traffic Act. If this is the only payment we make, it will not affect your no claim discount.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

RISK_EVENT.description: Event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.

OBJECT_OF_COVERAGE.description: Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car.

LOSS.description: Emergency medical treatment that must be provided under the Road Traffic Act

INDEMNITY.description: Pay for medical treatment

Could the damage to the windshield and any related bodywork be covered under the glass damage section of the policy even if not using an approved repairer?

description: I discovered the car door slightly ajar and noticed the dashboard had been tampered with. The permanently fitted CD player was missing, likely targeted during an attempted theft. Is there a possibility of recovering the loss of the CD player within the specified coverage limit?

sources.paragraph: We will pay for loss or damage to your cars permanently fitted in-car navigational equipment, car phones, radios, CD players, cassette players, games consoles or any other audio or visual equipment. Removable equipment is covered if it can only be used whilst it is attached to your car and is designed to be totally or partially removed.

- If the equipment was fitted by the manufacturer of your car and was part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then we will provide unlimited cover for the loss or damage of the equipment.

- If the equipment was not fitted by the manufacturer of your car or the equipment was not part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then the maximum we will pay for the loss or damage of the equipment is 500.
You are not covered for the following:
Any removable or portable equipment that is able to be used whilst not attached to your car. This equipment may be covered under Part E Personal belongings.

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

Fortunately, it was recovered a few days later, but the thieves had damaged the ignition system and stripped the interior of several components, including the stereo and navigation system. The cost to repair and replace everything was less than 60% of the car's original value. Could there be provisions for transportation or accommodation expenses incurred due to this incident?

sources.paragraph: If during the period of one year after the first registration as new your car is: - stolen and not recovered; or - damaged so that repairs will cost more than 60% of the manufacturers price list (including taxes and the cost of accessories) at the time of the loss or damage; and provided your car is owned by you then we will replace your car with a new one of the same make, model and specification. Provided that: - one is available - you and anyone else we know who has a financial interest in your car agree.

If your car is recovered before a new replacement is ordered and the cost of repairs are less than 60% of the manufacturers list price, we will do one of the following: - repair the damage - replace what is lost or damaged beyond economical repair or n pay you cash for the amount of the loss or damage.
You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. description: While driving to a business meeting, my business partner was involved in a serious accident. The car collided with another vehicle at a high speed. The collision resulted in the unfortunate death of a pedestrian. The authorities have initiated legal proceedings against my business partner for causing death by reckless driving. Is there coverage available to address the legal liabilities arising from this incident?

sources.paragraph:
This policy covers you for the amounts shown below:
a Death of or injury to any person unlimited.
b Damage to any other person's property up to £20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed £25,000,000
which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any person's property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.
The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above
- Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance.
- Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes.
- Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car.
- Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to:
- represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner's Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or
- defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction;
for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B - Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following:
1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one.
2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car.
3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

description: During a thunderstorm, lightning struck the garage where I store my car spare parts. The intense electrical surge damaged several components, including the alternator and ignition system. sources.paragraph: If your car, accessories or spare parts are lost, stolen or damaged, we will: - repair the damage; - replace what is lost or damaged and is too expensive to repair; or - pay you the cost of the loss or damage.

If your car is damaged, we will use one of our recommended repairers to repair it. If you choose not to use them, we may not pay more than our recommended repairer would have charged and we may choose to settle the claim by a financial payment. Following damage to your car, we may move your car to a place of safe and free storage pending settlement of any claim.

Where your car is not recovered following a theft or is beyond economical repair we will pay you the market value of your car, including accessories and spare parts at the time they are lost, stolen or damaged.
If we settle a claim as a total loss, we will then take ownership of your car.
Accessories and spare parts of your car, which are in your private garage at the time of their loss or damage, will also be covered.
You are not covered for the following:
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.

description: While driving to a business meeting, my business partner lost control of the vehicle on a wet road. The car skidded and collided with another vehicle, leading to a fatality. Legal proceedings for causing death by reckless driving have been initiated against my business partner. Is there coverage available to address the legal and financial implications of this incident?

sources.paragraph:
This policy covers you for the amounts shown below:
a Death of or injury to any person unlimited.
b Damage to any other person's property up to £20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed £25,000,000
which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any person's property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.
The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above
- Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance.
- Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes.
- Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car.
- Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to:
- represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner's Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or
- defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction;
for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B - Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following:
1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one.
2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car.
3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

INDEMNITY.description: Repair the damage - by approved repairer

SERVICE.description: Overnight accommodation, including the cost of meals and drinks, for the driver and passengers of your car

limit_targets: Scratching of the bodywork caused by the glass breaking

description: While parked in the driveway, my car suddenly exploded. The blast completely destroyed the vehicle, leaving nothing salvageable. Could there be provisions for transportation or accommodation for me and my passengers following this incident?

sources.paragraph: If your car, accessories or spare parts are lost, stolen or damaged, we will: - repair the damage; - replace what is lost or damaged and is too expensive to repair; or - pay you the cost of the loss or damage.

If your car is damaged, we will use one of our recommended repairers to repair it. If you choose not to use them, we may not pay more than our recommended repairer would have charged and we may choose to settle the claim by a financial payment. Following damage to your car, we may move your car to a place of safe and free storage pending settlement of any claim.

Where your car is not recovered following a theft or is beyond economical repair we will pay you the market value of your car, including accessories and spare parts at the time they are lost, stolen or damaged.
If we settle a claim as a total loss, we will then take ownership of your car.
Accessories and spare parts of your car, which are in your private garage at the time of their loss or damage, will also be covered.
- Unless we provide cover under this insurance, any other loss, damage or additional expense following on from the event for which you are claiming.*
You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. An example of an acceptable precaution is to attend the test drive with the prospective buyer. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.
Confiscation or requisition or destruction by, or under the order of, any government or public or land authority.

LOSS.description: Loss of car or spare parts

INDEMNITY.description: Replace what is lost or damaged

SERVICE.description: Overnight accommodation, including the cost of meals and drinks, for the driver and passengers of your car

description: While towing a caravan attached to my car, I was involved in an incident. A person was getting out of my car when the caravan unexpectedly swerved, causing a collision with another vehicle. Tragically, this resulted in a fatality, and I now face legal proceedings for causing death by reckless driving. Is there coverage available to address the legal and financial implications of this incident?

sources.paragraph:
This policy covers you for the amounts shown below:
a Death of or injury to any person unlimited.
b Damage to any other person's property up to £20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed £25,000,000
which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any person's property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.
The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above
- Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance.
- Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes.
- Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car.
- Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to:
- represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner's Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or
- defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction;
for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B - Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following:
1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one.
2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car.
3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

RISK_EVENT.description: Event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.

OBJECT_OF_COVERAGE.description: Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car.

LOSS.description: Legal proceedings for manslaughter or causing death by reckless driving

INDEMNITY.description: Pay for solicitors fees to represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner’s Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry

description: While driving, there was a sudden explosion from the engine compartment. The force of the blast shattered the windshield and side windows, causing extensive glass damage throughout the vehicle. Is there a provision for covering the costs of repairing or replacing the damaged glass if not using an approved repairer?

sources.paragraph: We will pay for the repair or replacement of glass in windows or windscreens (including panoramic windscreens) in your car and scratching of the bodywork caused by the glass breaking.
If you choose not to use one of our approved repairers we will limit the amount we pay under this section to 175.
The excess shown in your policy schedule or in Endorsement 29 Windscreen breakage if it is applicable. You will not have to pay this amount if the glass is repaired and not replaced.^

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.
You are not covered for the following:

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A - Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.

sources.paragraph: If during the period of one year after the first registration as new your car is: - stolen and not recovered; or - damaged so that repairs will cost more than 60% of the manufacturers price list (including taxes and the cost of accessories) at the time of the loss or damage; and provided your car is owned by you then we will replace your car with a new one of the same make, model and specification. Provided that: - one is available - you and anyone else we know who has a financial interest in your car agree.

description: While driving, the car suddenly exploded. The explosion damaged the permanently fitted in-car navigational equipment. The car was completely destroyed. Is there a possibility of recovering costs for the damaged equipment within the specified limits?

sources.paragraph: We will pay for loss or damage to your cars permanently fitted in-car navigational equipment, car phones, radios, CD players, cassette players, games consoles or any other audio or visual equipment. Removable equipment is covered if it can only be used whilst it is attached to your car and is designed to be totally or partially removed.

- If the equipment was fitted by the manufacturer of your car and was part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then we will provide unlimited cover for the loss or damage of the equipment.

- If the equipment was not fitted by the manufacturer of your car or the equipment was not part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then the maximum we will pay for the loss or damage of the equipment is 500.
You are not covered for the following:
Any removable or portable equipment that is able to be used whilst not attached to your car. This equipment may be covered under Part E Personal belongings.

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. sources.paragraph: If your car, accessories or spare parts are lost, stolen or damaged, we will: - repair the damage; - replace what is lost or damaged and is too expensive to repair; or - pay you the cost of the loss or damage.

If your car is damaged, we will use one of our recommended repairers to repair it. If you choose not to use them, we may not pay more than our recommended repairer would have charged and we may choose to settle the claim by a financial payment. Following damage to your car, we may move your car to a place of safe and free storage pending settlement of any claim.

Where your car is not recovered following a theft or is beyond economical repair we will pay you the market value of your car, including accessories and spare parts at the time they are lost, stolen or damaged.
If we settle a claim as a total loss, we will then take ownership of your car.
Accessories and spare parts of your car, which are in your private garage at the time of their loss or damage, will also be covered.
You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. An example of an acceptable precaution is to attend the test drive with the prospective buyer. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.

description: I accidentally filled my car with the wrong type of fuel at the gas station. Fortunately, there was no damage to the engine. Is there any coverage available for the costs incurred in rectifying this mistake?

sources.paragraph: If you or any named driver accidentally fill your car with the wrong fuel please do not start the engine. Please call us on our claims line as soon as possible.

If your car is subject to misfuelling during the period of insurance we will pay up to a maximum of £250 per claim for:
- Drainage and flushing of the fuel tank on site using a specialist roadside vehicle. Or
- Recovery of your car, the driver and up to 6 passengers to the nearest repairer to drain and flush the fuel tank.
- Replenishing the fuel tank with 10 litres of the correct fuel.
- Damage to your car engine caused solely and directly by misfuelling.
A £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.
Claims for misfuelling should be supported by original receipts and a written report from the specialist who drained or recovered your car.

Misfuelling exclusion
- any claim resulting from foreign matter entering the fuel system except for diesel or petroleum.
- claims for misfuelling outside the UK
- fuel, other than the 10 litres of correct fuel to replenish the fuel tank after draining and flushing out incorrect fuel.
- for damage to the engine, the excess shown in your schedule under accidental damage will apply.
- a £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.

LOSS.description: Misfuelling without damage to the engine

description: While towing a trailer with my car, an incident occurred. I had allowed my friend, who is listed on the certificate of insurance, to drive. sources.paragraph: This policy covers you for the amounts shown below: a Death of or injury to any person unlimited. b Damage to any other persons property up to 20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed 25,000,000 which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any persons property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car. The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

description: I accidentally filled my car with the wrong type of fuel at the gas station. Fortunately, there was no damage to the engine. Is there any coverage available for the costs incurred in rectifying this mistake?

sources.paragraph: If you or any named driver accidentally fill your car with the wrong fuel please do not start the engine. Please call us on our claims line as soon as possible.

If your car is subject to misfuelling during the period of insurance we will pay up to a maximum of £250 per claim for:
- Drainage and flushing of the fuel tank on site using a specialist roadside vehicle. Or
- Recovery of your car, the driver and up to 6 passengers to the nearest repairer to drain and flush the fuel tank.
- Replenishing the fuel tank with 10 litres of the correct fuel.
- Damage to your car engine caused solely and directly by misfuelling.
A £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.
Claims for misfuelling should be supported by original receipts and a written report from the specialist who drained or recovered your car.

Misfuelling exclusion
- any claim resulting from foreign matter entering the fuel system except for diesel or petroleum.
- claims for misfuelling outside the UK
- fuel, other than the 10 litres of correct fuel to replenish the fuel tank after draining and flushing out incorrect fuel.
- for damage to the engine, the excess shown in your schedule under accidental damage will apply.
- a £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.

LOSS.description: Misfuelling without damage to the engine

INDEMNITY.description: Recovery of your car, the driver and up to 6 passengers to the nearest repairer to drain and flush the fuel tank

description: During a sudden storm, a bolt of lightning struck a nearby tree, causing a large branch to fall onto my parked car. The impact shattered the windshield and damaged the side windows, leaving glass fragments scattered inside the vehicle. Is there a provision for covering the costs of repairing the glass damage caused by this incident if using an approved repairer?

sources.paragraph: We will pay for the repair or replacement of glass in windows or windscreens (including panoramic windscreens) in your car and scratching of the bodywork caused by the glass breaking.
If you choose not to use one of our approved repairers we will limit the amount we pay under this section to 175.
The excess shown in your policy schedule or in Endorsement 29 Windscreen breakage if it is applicable. You will not have to pay this amount if the glass is repaired and not replaced.^

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.
You are not covered for the following:

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A - Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.

LOSS.description: Glass damage

INDEMNITY.description: Repair the damage - by approved repairer

description: During a sudden storm, lightning struck nearby, sending a powerful surge through the ground. The electrical discharge caused significant damage to the car's electrical system, frying the onboard computer and rendering the vehicle inoperable. Could the damage to the car's electrical system be considered under the same provisions as glass-related incidents?

sources.paragraph: If your car, accessories or spare parts are lost, stolen or damaged, we will: - repair the damage; - replace what is lost or damaged and is too expensive to repair; or - pay you the cost of the loss or damage.

If your car is damaged, we will use one of our recommended repairers to repair it. If you choose not to use them, we may not pay more than our recommended repairer would have charged and we may choose to settle the claim by a financial payment. Following damage to your car, we may move your car to a place of safe and free storage pending settlement of any claim.

Where your car is not recovered following a theft or is beyond economical repair we will pay you the market value of your car, including accessories and spare parts at the time they are lost, stolen or damaged.
If we settle a claim as a total loss, we will then take ownership of your car.
Accessories and spare parts of your car, which are in your private garage at the time of their loss or damage, will also be covered.
You are not covered for the following:
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.

LOSS.description: Damage to car or spare parts

INDEMNITY.description: Replace what is lost or damaged

sources.paragraph: If the keys, lock transmitter or entry card for the keyless entry system of your car are lost or stolen, we will pay up to 1,000 towards the cost of replacing: - The door and boot locks - The ignition and steering locks n The lock transmitter; and - The entry card - Any other device designed and made by the manufacturer to access and start your car
Providing you report the loss to the police within 24 hours of discovering the loss.
You are not covered for the following:
Replacement locks exclusion - the theft excess shown in your schedule - any amount in excess of 1,000.

description: I parked my new car, less than a year old, in the driveway. That night, I heard a loud explosion. Rushing outside, I saw the car's interior engulfed in flames. The fire department arrived quickly and extinguished the blaze. The next day, I discovered the car had been stolen and later recovered. The damage was extensive, but the cost to repair it was less than 60% of the car's original value. Could there be provisions for transportation or accommodation for me and my passengers during this ordeal?

sources.paragraph: If during the period of one year after the first registration as new your car is: - stolen and not recovered; or - damaged so that repairs will cost more than 60% of the manufacturers price list (including taxes and the cost of accessories) at the time of the loss or damage; and provided your car is owned by you then we will replace your car with a new one of the same make, model and specification. Provided that: - one is available - you and anyone else we know who has a financial interest in your car agree.

If your car is recovered before a new replacement is ordered and the cost of repairs are less than 60% of the manufacturers list price, we will do one of the following: - repair the damage - replace what is lost or damaged beyond economical repair or n pay you cash for the amount of the loss or damage.
You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. An example of an acceptable precaution is to attend the test drive with the prospective buyer. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.

LOSS.description: Theft with recovery and  costing less than 60% of new car to repair

SERVICE.description: Courtesy car

description: I lent my car to a friend who is listed in the certificate of insurance. While driving, they collided with a pedestrian at a crosswalk. The pedestrian was fatally injured. My friend is now facing legal proceedings for causing death by reckless driving. Is there coverage available for legal expenses and liabilities up to the policy's limit in this situation?

sources.paragraph:
This policy covers you for the amounts shown below:
a Death of or injury to any person unlimited.
b Damage to any other person's property up to £20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed £25,000,000
which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any person's property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.
The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above
- Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance.
- Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes.
- Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car.
- Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to:
- represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner's Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or
- defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction;
for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B - Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following:
1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one.
2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car.
3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

RISK_EVENT.description: Event involving you driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive

OBJECT_OF_COVERAGE.description: Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance.

LOSS.description: Legal proceedings for manslaughter or causing death by reckless driving

INDEMNITY.description: Pay for solicitors fees to represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner’s Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry

The excess shown in your policy schedule or in Endorsement 29 Windscreen breakage if it is applicable. You will not have to pay this amount if the glass is repaired and not replaced.^

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.
You are not covered for the following:

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A - Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.

INDEMNITY.description: Repair the damage - by not approved repairer

description: I discovered someone had attempted to steal my car. The driver's side window was shattered, and the dashboard had been tampered with. Several tools were scattered on the seat, and the stereo system was missing. Could there be provisions for transportation or accommodation while addressing this incident?

sources.paragraph: If your car, accessories or spare parts are lost, stolen or damaged, we will: - repair the damage; - replace what is lost or damaged and is too expensive to repair; or - pay you the cost of the loss or damage.

If your car is damaged, we will use one of our recommended repairers to repair it. If you choose not to use them, we may not pay more than our recommended repairer would have charged and we may choose to settle the claim by a financial payment. Following damage to your car, we may move your car to a place of safe and free storage pending settlement of any claim.

Where your car is not recovered following a theft or is beyond economical repair we will pay you the market value of your car, including accessories and spare parts at the time they are lost, stolen or damaged.
If we settle a claim as a total loss, we will then take ownership of your car.
Accessories and spare parts of your car, which are in your private garage at the time of their loss or damage, will also be covered.
You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. An example of an acceptable precaution is to attend the test drive with the prospective buyer. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.

LOSS.description: Theft to car or spare parts

INDEMNITY.description: Repair the damage - by not approved repairer

SERVICE.description: Public transport for the driver and the passengers of your car to return to your home or your original planned destination.

description: During a storm, lightning struck my car while it was parked in the driveway. The electrical surge caused by the lightning damaged the CD player, permanently fitted by the manufacturer. Is there a possibility of recovering the costs for the damaged equipment within the specified coverage limits?

sources.paragraph: We will pay for loss or damage to your cars permanently fitted in-car navigational equipment, car phones, radios, CD players, cassette players, games consoles or any other audio or visual equipment. Removable equipment is covered if it can only be used whilst it is attached to your car and is designed to be totally or partially removed.

- If the equipment was fitted by the manufacturer of your car and was part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then we will provide unlimited cover for the loss or damage of the equipment.

- If the equipment was not fitted by the manufacturer of your car or the equipment was not part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then the maximum we will pay for the loss or damage of the equipment is 500.
You are not covered for the following:
Any removable or portable equipment that is able to be used whilst not attached to your car. This equipment may be covered under Part E Personal belongings.

description: While driving, I accidentally rear-ended a parked car, causing damage to its bumper and taillights. Is there a provision for covering the damages caused to the other vehicle within the policy limits?

sources.paragraph: This policy covers you for the amounts shown below: a Death of or injury to any person unlimited. b Damage to any other persons property up to 20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed 25,000,000 which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any persons property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car. The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

RISK_EVENT.description: Event involving you driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive

LOSS.description: Damage to any other person property

INDEMNITY.description: Pay for legal liability

description: While driving on the highway, another vehicle suddenly swerved into my lane, causing a collision. The impact shattered the windshield, and shards of glass struck my face. As a result, I suffered a total and irrecoverable loss of sight in my right eye. Is there a provision for compensation for my personal injury under the policy limits?

sources.paragraph: If: - you or your spouse are injured solely as a result of an accident involving your car; or while travelling in or getting into or out of your car; or - any other person is injured -while travelling in or getting into or out of your car; we will pay you or your legal representatives or if you ask us to, the person injured or their legal representative the compensation specified below: Provided that death or loss occurs within three calendar months and solely and directly as a result of the accident.

You are not covered for the following: - any person who, at the time of the injury, has not reached their sixteenth birthday; - in respect of death or injury as a result of suicide, attempted suicide or any intentional self-injury.

description: I discovered my new car, less than a year old, missing from the driveway. After a few days, it was found abandoned in a nearby area. The thieves had damaged the ignition system and removed several electronic components. The repair costs were substantial but amounted to less than 60% of the car's original value. Could there be provisions for transportation or accommodation expenses incurred during this ordeal?

sources.paragraph: If during the period of one year after the first registration as new your car is: - stolen and not recovered; or - damaged so that repairs will cost more than 60% of the manufacturers price list (including taxes and the cost of accessories) at the time of the loss or damage; and provided your car is owned by you then we will replace your car with a new one of the same make, model and specification. Provided that: - one is available - you and anyone else we know who has a financial interest in your car agree.

If your car is recovered before a new replacement is ordered and the cost of repairs are less than 60% of the manufacturers list price, we will do one of the following: - repair the damage - replace what is lost or damaged beyond economical repair or n pay you cash for the amount of the loss or damage.
You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. An example of an acceptable precaution is to attend the test drive with the prospective buyer. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.

Where your car is not recovered following a theft or is beyond economical repair we will pay you the market value of your car, including accessories and spare parts at the time they are lost, stolen or damaged.
If we settle a claim as a total loss, we will then take ownership of your car.
Accessories and spare parts of your car, which are in your private garage at the time of their loss or damage, will also be covered.
You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. An example of an acceptable precaution is to attend the test drive with the prospective buyer. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.

description: While driving my car with a trailer attached, the trailer accidentally detached and collided with another vehicle. My friend, who is listed on the certificate of insurance, was driving at the time. We now face legal costs due to the incident. Could the policy cover the legal expenses incurred from this accident?

sources.paragraph: This policy covers you for the amounts shown below: a Death of or injury to any person unlimited. b Damage to any other persons property up to 20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed 25,000,000 which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any persons property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car. The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to: - represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroners Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or - defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction; for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

sources.paragraph: If during the period of one year after the first registration as new your car is: - stolen and not recovered; or - damaged so that repairs will cost more than 60% of the manufacturers price list (including taxes and the cost of accessories) at the time of the loss or damage; and provided your car is owned by you then we will replace your car with a new one of the same make, model and specification. Provided that: - one is available - you and anyone else we know who has a financial interest in your car agree.

If your car is recovered before a new replacement is ordered and the cost of repairs are less than 60% of the manufacturers list price, we will do one of the following: - repair the damage - replace what is lost or damaged beyond economical repair or n pay you cash for the amount of the loss or damage.

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. description: While driving, I noticed smoke coming from the dashboard. I pulled over and saw flames near the CD player. The fire spread quickly, leading to the total loss of the car. Is there a provision for covering the loss within the specified limit?

sources.paragraph: We will pay for loss or damage to your cars permanently fitted in-car navigational equipment, car phones, radios, CD players, cassette players, games consoles or any other audio or visual equipment. Removable equipment is covered if it can only be used whilst it is attached to your car and is designed to be totally or partially removed.

- If the equipment was fitted by the manufacturer of your car and was part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then we will provide unlimited cover for the loss or damage of the equipment.

- If the equipment was not fitted by the manufacturer of your car or the equipment was not part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then the maximum we will pay for the loss or damage of the equipment is 500.
You are not covered for the following:
Any removable or portable equipment that is able to be used whilst not attached to your car. This equipment may be covered under Part E Personal belongings.

Provided that: - one is available - you and anyone else we know who has a financial interest in your car agree.

If your car is recovered before a new replacement is ordered and the cost of repairs are less than 60% of the manufacturers list price, we will do one of the following: - repair the damage - replace what is lost or damaged beyond economical repair or n pay you cash for the amount of the loss or damage.
You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.

sources.paragraph: If your car, accessories or spare parts are lost, stolen or damaged, we will: - repair the damage; - replace what is lost or damaged and is too expensive to repair; or - pay you the cost of the loss or damage.

If your car is damaged, we will use one of our recommended repairers to repair it. If you choose not to use them, we may not pay more than our recommended repairer would have charged and we may choose to settle the claim by a financial payment. Following damage to your car, we may move your car to a place of safe and free storage pending settlement of any claim.

Where your car is not recovered following a theft or is beyond economical repair we will pay you the market value of your car, including accessories and spare parts at the time they are lost, stolen or damaged.
If we settle a claim as a total loss, we will then take ownership of your car.
Accessories and spare parts of your car, which are in your private garage at the time of their loss or damage, will also be covered.
You are not covered for the following:
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.

sources.paragraph: If: - you or your spouse are injured solely as a result of an accident involving your car; or while travelling in or getting into or out of your car; or - any other person is injured -while travelling in or getting into or out of your car; we will pay you or your legal representatives or if you ask us to, the person injured or their legal representative the compensation specified below: Provided that death or loss occurs within three calendar months and solely and directly as a result of the accident.

You are not covered for the following: - any person who, at the time of the injury, has not reached their sixteenth birthday; - in respect of death or injury as a result of suicide, attempted suicide or any intentional self-injury.

description: I allowed my friend, who is listed on the certificate of insurance, to drive my car. While towing a caravan, the car was involved in a collision with a pedestrian. The incident led to legal proceedings for causing death by reckless driving. Is there coverage available for legal expenses and liabilities in this situation?

sources.paragraph:
This policy covers you for the amounts shown below:
a Death of or injury to any person unlimited.
b Damage to any other person's property up to £20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed £25,000,000
which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any person's property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.
The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above
- Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance.
- Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes.
- Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car.
- Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to:
- represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner's Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or
- defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction;
for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B - Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following:
1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one.
2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car.
3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

RISK_EVENT.description: Event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.

OBJECT_OF_COVERAGE.description: Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance.

LOSS.description: Legal proceedings for manslaughter or causing death by reckless driving

INDEMNITY.description: Pay for solicitors fees to defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction

sources.paragraph: We will pay for loss or damage to your cars permanently fitted in-car navigational equipment, car phones, radios, CD players, cassette players, games consoles or any other audio or visual equipment. Removable equipment is covered if it can only be used whilst it is attached to your car and is designed to be totally or partially removed.

- If the equipment was fitted by the manufacturer of your car and was part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then we will provide unlimited cover for the loss or damage of the equipment.

- If the equipment was not fitted by the manufacturer of your car or the equipment was not part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then the maximum we will pay for the loss or damage of the equipment is 500.
You are not covered for the following:
Any removable or portable equipment that is able to be used whilst not attached to your car. This equipment may be covered under Part E Personal belongings.

sources.paragraph: This policy covers you for the amounts shown below: a Death of or injury to any person unlimited. b Damage to any other persons property up to 20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed 25,000,000 which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any persons property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car. The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to: - represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroners Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or - defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction; for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

RISK_EVENT.description: Event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.

LOSS.description: Legal costs and expenses

INDEMNITY.description: Pay for solicitors fees to defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction

description: While driving, I noticed smoke coming from the dashboard area. Suddenly, a fire erupted, damaging the stereo system and GPS unit. The flames spread quickly, causing significant damage to the car's interior accessories. Could the damage to the car's interior be considered under the policy's specific coverage for glass-related incidents?

sources.paragraph: If your car, accessories or spare parts are lost, stolen or damaged, we will: - repair the damage; - replace what is lost or damaged and is too expensive to repair; or - pay you the cost of the loss or damage.

If your car is damaged, we will use one of our recommended repairers to repair it. If you choose not to use them, we may not pay more than our recommended repairer would have charged and we may choose to settle the claim by a financial payment. Following damage to your car, we may move your car to a place of safe and free storage pending settlement of any claim.

Where your car is not recovered following a theft or is beyond economical repair we will pay you the market value of your car, including accessories and spare parts at the time they are lost, stolen or damaged.
If we settle a claim as a total loss, we will then take ownership of your car.
Accessories and spare parts of your car, which are in your private garage at the time of their loss or damage, will also be covered.
You are not covered for the following:
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.

LOSS.description: Damage to car or spare parts

INDEMNITY.description: Repair the damage - by not approved repairer

sources.paragraph: If: - you or your spouse are injured solely as a result of an accident involving your car; or while travelling in or getting into or out of your car; or - any other person is injured -while travelling in or getting into or out of your car; we will pay you or your legal representatives or if you ask us to, the person injured or their legal representative the compensation specified below: Provided that death or loss occurs within three calendar months and solely and directly as a result of the accident.

You are not covered for the following: - any person who, at the time of the injury, has not reached their sixteenth birthday; - in respect of death or injury as a result of suicide, attempted suicide or any intentional self-injury.

sources.paragraph: We will pay for the repair or replacement of glass in windows or windscreens (including panoramic windscreens) in your car and scratching of the bodywork caused by the glass breaking.
If you choose not to use one of our approved repairers we will limit the amount we pay under this section to 175.
The excess shown in your policy schedule or in Endorsement 29 Windscreen breakage if it is applicable. You will not have to pay this amount if the glass is repaired and not replaced.^

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.
You are not covered for the following:

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. The interior was damaged by a small fire, affecting the seats and dashboard. Repairs were needed but cost less than 60% of the car’s original price. Could I receive support for transportation or accommodation while addressing the aftermath of this incident?

sources.paragraph: If during the period of one year after the first registration as new your car is: - stolen and not recovered; or - damaged so that repairs will cost more than 60% of the manufacturers price list (including taxes and the cost of accessories) at the time of the loss or damage; and provided your car is owned by you then we will replace your car with a new one of the same make, model and specification. Provided that: - one is available - you and anyone else we know who has a financial interest in your car agree.

If your car is recovered before a new replacement is ordered and the cost of repairs are less than 60% of the manufacturers list price, we will do one of the following: - repair the damage - replace what is lost or damaged beyond economical repair or n pay you cash for the amount of the loss or damage.
You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.

description: While driving my car with a trailer attached, I was involved in an accident that resulted in a fatality. My business partner was charged with causing death by reckless driving. Is there coverage available for liabilities arising from this incident?

sources.paragraph:
This policy covers you for the amounts shown below:
a Death of or injury to any person unlimited.
b Damage to any other person's property up to £20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed £25,000,000
which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any person's property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.
The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above
- Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance.
- Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes.
- Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car.
- Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to:
- represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner's Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or
- defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction;
for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B - Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following:
1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one.
2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car.
3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.
