If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.
We will pay for any emergency medical treatment that must be provided under the Road Traffic Act. If this is the only payment we make, it will not affect your no claim discount.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

description: I discovered that several car spare parts were stolen from my garage. The thieves took the time to dismantle the headlights and side mirrors. In the process, they damaged the front bumper, leaving it with noticeable scratches and dents. Could the damage to the bumper be considered under the policy's coverage for scratching caused by glass breaking?

sources.paragraph: If your car, accessories or spare parts are lost, stolen or damaged, we will: - repair the damage; - replace what is lost or damaged and is too expensive to repair; or - pay you the cost of the loss or damage.

If your car is damaged, we will use one of our recommended repairers to repair it. If you choose not to use them, we may not pay more than our recommended repairer would have charged and we may choose to settle the claim by a financial payment. Following damage to your car, we may move your car to a place of safe and free storage pending settlement of any claim.

Where your car is not recovered following a theft or is beyond economical repair we will pay you the market value of your car, including accessories and spare parts at the time they are lost, stolen or damaged.
If we settle a claim as a total loss, we will then take ownership of your car.
Accessories and spare parts of your car, which are in your private garage at the time of their loss or damage, will also be covered.
You are not covered for the following:
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.

LOSS.description: Damage to car or spare parts

description: While towing a caravan with my car, I failed to notice a traffic signal and collided with a pedestrian crossing the road. The impact resulted in the pedestrian's death. As a result, I am facing legal proceedings for causing death by reckless driving. Is there coverage available to address the legal liabilities arising from this incident?

sources.paragraph:
This policy covers you for the amounts shown below:
a Death of or injury to any person unlimited.
b Damage to any other person's property up to £20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed £25,000,000
which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any person's property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.
The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above
- Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance.
- Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes.
- Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car.
- Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to:
- represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner's Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or
- defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction;
for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B - Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following:
1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one.
2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car.
3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

RISK_EVENT.description: Event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.

LOSS.description: Legal proceedings for manslaughter or causing death by reckless driving

INDEMNITY.description: Pay for solicitors fees to represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner’s Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry

sources.paragraph: We will pay for loss or damage to your cars permanently fitted in-car navigational equipment, car phones, radios, CD players, cassette players, games consoles or any other audio or visual equipment. Removable equipment is covered if it can only be used whilst it is attached to your car and is designed to be totally or partially removed.

- If the equipment was fitted by the manufacturer of your car and was part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then we will provide unlimited cover for the loss or damage of the equipment.

- If the equipment was not fitted by the manufacturer of your car or the equipment was not part of the standard specification of your car when it was first registered then the maximum we will pay for the loss or damage of the equipment is 500.
You are not covered for the following:
Any removable or portable equipment that is able to be used whilst not attached to your car. This equipment may be covered under Part E Personal belongings.

sources.paragraph: If: - you or your spouse are injured solely as a result of an accident involving your car; or while travelling in or getting into or out of your car; or - any other person is injured -while travelling in or getting into or out of your car; we will pay you or your legal representatives or if you ask us to, the person injured or their legal representative the compensation specified below: Provided that death or loss occurs within three calendar months and solely and directly as a result of the accident.

You are not covered for the following: - any person who, at the time of the injury, has not reached their sixteenth birthday; - in respect of death or injury as a result of suicide, attempted suicide or any intentional self-injury.

sources.paragraph: This policy covers you for the amounts shown below: a Death of or injury to any person unlimited. b Damage to any other persons property up to 20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed 25,000,000 which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any persons property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car. The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

If you choose not to use one of our approved repairers we will limit the amount we pay under this section to 175.
The excess shown in your policy schedule or in Endorsement 29 Windscreen breakage if it is applicable. You will not have to pay this amount if the glass is repaired and not replaced.^

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.

A thief had broken in and taken a folder containing important documents from the glove compartment. Additionally, they rummaged through the back seat, damaging my laptop bag in the process. Is there any possibility of recovering costs for the damaged items?

sources.paragraph: We will pay up to a maximum of 300 for personal belongings carried in or on your car if lost or damaged by: - accident to your car; - fire, lightning, explosion; n theft or attempted theft.

You are not covered for the following: - money, stamps, tickets, documents or securities; - tools, equipment, goods or samples carried in connection with any trade or business; - property insured by another policy; - theft of personal belongings if carried in an open-top or convertible car, unless contained in the locked boot.

OBJECT_OF_COVERAGE.description: Money, stamps, tickets, documents or securities

LOSS.description: Damage to personal belongings

INDEMNITY.description: Pay the cost of loss or damage

description: I discovered that the garage had been broken into overnight. The thieves had targeted my car, specifically taking the headlights and the side mirrors. Is there any potential for coverage reconsideration given the specific items stolen?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:

Audio visual equipment and in-car entertainment systems exclusion Any removable or portable equipment that is able to be used whilst not attached to your car. This equipment may be covered under Part E Personal belongings.

LOSS.description: Loss of car or spare parts

description: During a routine inspection at a border checkpoint, officials confiscated several car spare parts from my vehicle. They claimed the parts were required for an ongoing investigation by the government. The confiscated items included a set of brake pads and a spare tire. Is there any possibility of recovering the value of these items despite the lack of coverage?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:
Confiscation or requisition or destruction by, or under the order of, any government or public or land authority.

LOSS.description: Confiscation or requisition or destruction by, or under the order of, any government or public or land authority

RISK_EVENT.description: Any incident that could result in damage or loss to a vehicle, as outlined in an auto insurance policy.

description: I was driving down the highway when a large piece of debris struck my car. The impact damaged the windshield and several other parts, including the side mirror and a section of the front bumper. The repairs required replacing the windshield and mirror, which improved the car beyond its previous condition. Could the improvements made during repairs affect the eligibility for coverage?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:
Loss of or damage to your car arising from or as a result of water freezing in the cooling circulation system of your car.

LOSS.description: The cost of any repair or replacement which improves your car beyond the condition it was in before the loss or damage occurred

RISK_EVENT.description: Any incident that could result in damage or loss to a vehicle, as outlined in an auto insurance policy.

description: I parked my car on the street and accidentally left it unlocked with the keys inside. When I returned, the car's stereo system and a few other spare parts were missing. It seems someone tried to steal the car but settled for taking parts instead. Could there be any potential coverage considerations for the stolen parts despite the circumstances?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:
Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car, or on it.

LOSS.description: Loss or damage to your car by theft or attempted theft if you or anyone else has left it unlocked or with keys or keyless entry system in your car,

RISK_EVENT.description: Any incident that may result in damages or loss to an automobile, as specified in an auto insurance policy

description: While towing a caravan, my car was involved in an incident. The person driving was disqualified from driving. Legal costs and expenses ensued. Could there be any potential coverage for legal expenses despite the disqualification?

sources.paragraph: This policy covers you for the amounts shown below: a Death of or injury to any person unlimited. b Damage to any other persons property up to 20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed 25,000,000 which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any persons property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car. The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to: - represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroners Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or - defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction; for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

RISK_EVENT.description: Event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.

OBJECT_OF_COVERAGE.description: Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one.

LOSS.description: Legal costs and expenses

INDEMNITY.description: Pay for solicitors fees to represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner’s Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry

description: During a routine inspection, government officials arrived at the garage and declared that several car spare parts, including the catalytic converter and the exhaust system, were not compliant with new environmental regulations. Without prior notice, they ordered the immediate confiscation of these parts, citing the need to uphold public safety standards. Is there any recourse available for unexpected regulatory compliance issues?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:
Confiscation or requisition or destruction by, or under the order of, any government or public or land authority.

LOSS.description: Confiscation or requisition or destruction by, or under the order of, any government or public or land authority

RISK_EVENT.description: Any circumstance that might result in damage or loss to a car, as mentioned in a car insurance policy.

description: I received a call from someone claiming to be a mechanic from a reputable garage, stating they needed to replace some faulty car parts under warranty. They requested I leave my car keys in a designated area for pickup. Trusting the call, I complied. Later, I discovered my car was missing, and the spare parts, including the new tires and battery, were gone. It became clear I had been deceived, resulting in the loss of my car and specified parts. Could there be any potential coverage for losses incurred due to fraudulent schemes?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. An example of an acceptable precaution is to attend the test drive with the prospective buyer. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.

LOSS.description: Loss or theft of your car by deception.

RISK_EVENT.description: Any occurrence that may lead to harm or loss of a car, as specified in a car insurance policy.

description: I parked my car in the driveway overnight. In the morning, I discovered that someone had attempted to break into the vehicle. The sunroof was shattered, likely from an attempted theft. Nothing else seemed disturbed, but the glass damage was extensive. Is there any possibility of coverage for the damage despite the current limits?

sources.paragraph: We will pay for the repair or replacement of glass in windows or windscreens (including panoramic windscreens) in your car and scratching of the bodywork caused by the glass breaking.
If you choose not to use one of our approved repairers we will limit the amount we pay under this section to 175.
The excess shown in your policy schedule or in Endorsement 29 Windscreen breakage if it is applicable. You will not have to pay this amount if the glass is repaired and not replaced.^

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.
You are not covered for the following:

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A - Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.

OBJECT_OF_COVERAGE.description: Any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass

LOSS.description: Glass damage

INDEMNITY.description: Repair the damage - by not approved repairer

description: I parked my car in a public lot. When I returned, it was gone. Later, I discovered it had been taken by someone and returned to its legal owner, who was not me. Is there any recourse available for situations where ownership disputes arise?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:

description: While refueling my car, I accidentally dropped a coin in the fuel tank. Fortunately, there was no damage to the engine. Could there be any potential coverage for incidents involving accidental foreign objects in the fuel system?

sources.paragraph: If you or any named driver accidentally fill your car with the wrong fuel please do not start the engine. Please call us on our claims line as soon as possible.

If your car is subject to misfuelling during the period of insurance we will pay up to a maximum of £250 per claim for:
- Drainage and flushing of the fuel tank on site using a specialist roadside vehicle. Or
- Recovery of your car, the driver and up to 6 passengers to the nearest repairer to drain and flush the fuel tank.
- Replenishing the fuel tank with 10 litres of the correct fuel.
- Damage to your car engine caused solely and directly by misfuelling.
A £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.
Claims for misfuelling should be supported by original receipts and a written report from the specialist who drained or recovered your car.

Misfuelling exclusion
- any claim resulting from foreign matter entering the fuel system except for diesel or petroleum.
- claims for misfuelling outside the UK
- fuel, other than the 10 litres of correct fuel to replenish the fuel tank after draining and flushing out incorrect fuel.
- for damage to the engine, the excess shown in your schedule under accidental damage will apply.
- a £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.

RISK_EVENT.description: Foreign matter entering the fuel system except for diesel or petroleum

LOSS.description: Misfuelling without damage to the engine

INDEMNITY.description: Drainage and flushing of the fuel tank on site

limit_targets: Drainage and flushing of the fuel tank on site using a specialist roadside vehicle

description: I accidentally put some engine oil inside the fuel tank. Fortunately, there was no damage to the engine. Is there any possibility of coverage in such situations?

sources.paragraph: If you or any named driver accidentally fill your car with the wrong fuel please do not start the engine. Please call us on our claims line as soon as possible.

If your car is subject to misfuelling during the period of insurance we will pay up to a maximum of £250 per claim for:
- Drainage and flushing of the fuel tank on site using a specialist roadside vehicle. Or
- Recovery of your car, the driver and up to 6 passengers to the nearest repairer to drain and flush the fuel tank.
- Replenishing the fuel tank with 10 litres of the correct fuel.
- Damage to your car engine caused solely and directly by misfuelling.
A £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.
Claims for misfuelling should be supported by original receipts and a written report from the specialist who drained or recovered your car.

Misfuelling exclusion
- any claim resulting from foreign matter entering the fuel system except for diesel or petroleum.
- claims for misfuelling outside the UK
- fuel, other than the 10 litres of correct fuel to replenish the fuel tank after draining and flushing out incorrect fuel.
- for damage to the engine, the excess shown in your schedule under accidental damage will apply.
- a £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.

RISK_EVENT.description: Foreign matter entering the fuel system except for diesel or petroleum

LOSS.description: Misfuelling without damage to the engine

INDEMNITY.description: Repair the damages to car engine due to misfuelling

Damage to your car engine caused solely and directly by misfuelling.

He convinced me to leave the car with him, promising a quick turnaround. When I returned, both the car and the man were gone. I realized I had been deceived and lost several valuable spare parts. description: While towing a caravan with my car, an unlicensed driver took the wheel. During the drive, the car collided with a pedestrian, resulting in a fatality. Legal proceedings for manslaughter are now underway. Could there be any potential coverage considerations given the severity of the incident and the policy limits?

sources.paragraph:
This policy covers you for the amounts shown below:
a Death of or injury to any person unlimited.
b Damage to any other person's property up to £20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed £25,000,000
which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any person's property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.
The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above
- Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance.
- Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes.
- Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car.
- Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to:
- represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner's Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or
- defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction;
for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B - Liability to others of this policy.

You are not covered for the following:
1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one.
2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car.
3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

RISK_EVENT.description: Event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car.

OBJECT_OF_COVERAGE.description: Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one.

LOSS.description: Legal proceedings for manslaughter or causing death by reckless driving

INDEMNITY.description: Pay for solicitors fees to represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroner’s Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry

sources.paragraph: We will pay for the repair or replacement of glass in windows or windscreens (including panoramic windscreens) in your car and scratching of the bodywork caused by the glass breaking.
If you choose not to use one of our approved repairers we will limit the amount we pay under this section to 175.
The excess shown in your policy schedule or in Endorsement 29 Windscreen breakage if it is applicable. You will not have to pay this amount if the glass is repaired and not replaced.^

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.

sources.paragraph: If you or any named driver accidentally fill your car with the wrong fuel please do not start the engine. Please call us on our claims line as soon as possible.

If your car is subject to misfuelling during the period of insurance we will pay up to a maximum of £250 per claim for:
- Drainage and flushing of the fuel tank on site using a specialist roadside vehicle. Or
- Recovery of your car, the driver and up to 6 passengers to the nearest repairer to drain and flush the fuel tank.
- Replenishing the fuel tank with 10 litres of the correct fuel.
- Damage to your car engine caused solely and directly by misfuelling.
A £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.
Claims for misfuelling should be supported by original receipts and a written report from the specialist who drained or recovered your car.

Misfuelling exclusion
- any claim resulting from foreign matter entering the fuel system except for diesel or petroleum.
- claims for misfuelling outside the UK
- fuel, other than the 10 litres of correct fuel to replenish the fuel tank after draining and flushing out incorrect fuel.
- for damage to the engine, the excess shown in your schedule under accidental damage will apply.
- a £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.

RISK_EVENT.description: Foreign matter entering the fuel system except for diesel or petroleum

LOSS.description: Misfuelling without damage to the engine

You are not covered for the following: - money, stamps, tickets, documents or securities; - tools, equipment, goods or samples carried in connection with any trade or business; - property insured by another policy; - theft of personal belongings if carried in an open-top or convertible car, unless contained in the locked boot.

description: While I was away, someone who had never held a driving licence took my car without permission. They drove through a narrow street and collided with a parked vehicle, causing significant damage to its bumper and side mirror. Is there any potential liability coverage for damages caused by unauthorized use of my vehicle?

sources.paragraph: This policy covers you for the amounts shown below: a Death of or injury to any person unlimited. b Damage to any other persons property up to 20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed 25,000,000 which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any persons property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car. The same cover will apply if you are driving any other car which your certificate of insurance allows you to drive. This cover ceases if you dispose of your car shown in the certificate of insurance or it becomes a total loss.*

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

sources.paragraph: This policy covers you for the amounts shown below: a Death of or injury to any person unlimited. b Damage to any other persons property up to 20,000,000, plus all legal costs and expenses provided the total does not exceed 25,000,000 which you become legally responsible for paying due to the death of or injury to any person and damage to any persons property in respect of any claim or series of claims arising out of one event involving your car, or caused by a trailer, caravan or other vehicle that is attached to your car. If we give our written permission, we will pay for solicitors fees to: - represent anyone insured under this policy at any Coroners Inquest or Fatal Accident Inquiry; or - defend anyone insured under this policy in a court of summary jurisdiction; for any incident which might give rise to a claim under Part B Liability to others of this policy.

If you choose not to use one of our approved repairers we will limit the amount we pay under this section to 175.
The excess shown in your policy schedule or in Endorsement 29 Windscreen breakage if it is applicable. You will not have to pay this amount if the glass is repaired and not replaced.^

If you ask us to, we will give the following people the same level of cover as provided in 1 above - Anyone you allow to drive your car and who is allowed to drive it in the certificate of insurance. - Any person using (but not driving) your car with your permission for social, domestic and pleasure purposes. - Any person travelling in or getting into or out of your car. - Your employer or business partner, as long as your car is not owned by or hired to either your employer or business partner and your car is being used for a purpose that is allowed in your certificate of insurance.

You are not covered for the following: 1 Anyone driving your car who is disqualified from driving or has never held a driving licence, or is prevented by law from holding one. 2 Liability for loss of or damage to property which belongs to, or is with, any person who is insured under this policy and who is driving your car. 3 Any loss of or damage to property, legal liability, injury or other loss directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by or arising from terrorism or any action taken in controlling preventing suppressing or in any way relating to terrorism. However this policy covers you so far as is necessary to meet any law on compulsory insurance.

sources.paragraph: We will pay for the repair or replacement of glass in windows or windscreens (including panoramic windscreens) in your car and scratching of the bodywork caused by the glass breaking.
If you choose not to use one of our approved repairers we will limit the amount we pay under this section to 175.
The excess shown in your policy schedule or in Endorsement 29 Windscreen breakage if it is applicable. You will not have to pay this amount if the glass is repaired and not replaced.^

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.
You are not covered for the following:

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. description: I accidentally drop a coin inside the fuel tank while refueling. Fortunately, there was no damage to the engine. Could there be any potential coverage for incidents like this despite the lack of immediate damage?

sources.paragraph: If you or any named driver accidentally fill your car with the wrong fuel please do not start the engine. Please call us on our claims line as soon as possible.

If your car is subject to misfuelling during the period of insurance we will pay up to a maximum of £250 per claim for:
- Drainage and flushing of the fuel tank on site using a specialist roadside vehicle. Or
- Recovery of your car, the driver and up to 6 passengers to the nearest repairer to drain and flush the fuel tank.
- Replenishing the fuel tank with 10 litres of the correct fuel.
- Damage to your car engine caused solely and directly by misfuelling.
A £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.
Claims for misfuelling should be supported by original receipts and a written report from the specialist who drained or recovered your car.

Misfuelling exclusion
- any claim resulting from foreign matter entering the fuel system except for diesel or petroleum.
- claims for misfuelling outside the UK
- fuel, other than the 10 litres of correct fuel to replenish the fuel tank after draining and flushing out incorrect fuel.
- for damage to the engine, the excess shown in your schedule under accidental damage will apply.
- a £75 excess applies in respect of claims for draining and flushing the fuel tank.

description: While driving home, a large tree branch fell onto my car, damaging the hood and front bumper. The impact also shattered the left headlight and cracked the windshield. The repairs included replacing the hood and bumper, which improved the car beyond its previous condition. Could the enhancements made during repairs affect the claim's eligibility?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:
Loss of or damage to your car arising from or as a result of water freezing in the cooling circulation system of your car.

description: I parked my car on the street overnight. In the morning, I found the driver's side window shattered. The ignition was tampered with, and the car was missing. Later, the police informed me they recovered it and returned it to its legal owner. Could there be any potential coverage considerations for the damages incurred during the theft?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:
Loss from taking your car and returning it to its legal owner.

LOSS.description: Loss from taking your car and returning it to its legal owner.

RISK_EVENT.description: Any occurrence that might result in harm or loss to a car, as outlined in a car insurance policy.

description: During a storm, lightning struck nearby, causing a shockwave that shattered the panoramic sunroof of my car. The glass was completely damaged, with shards scattered across the interior. Could there be any reconsideration for coverage in such unforeseen natural events?

sources.paragraph: We will pay for the repair or replacement of glass in windows or windscreens (including panoramic windscreens) in your car and scratching of the bodywork caused by the glass breaking.
If you choose not to use one of our approved repairers we will limit the amount we pay under this section to 175.
The excess shown in your policy schedule or in Endorsement 29 Windscreen breakage if it is applicable. You will not have to pay this amount if the glass is repaired and not replaced.^

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.
You are not covered for the following:

To repair or replace any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass. Please note, you may be entitled to make a claim for other glass under Part A - Loss and damage (Subsection 1), this will however be subject to a different excess and may impact your no claims discount.

OBJECT_OF_COVERAGE.description: Any other glass forming part of your car including sunroofs and panoramic sunroofs, where the roof glass is a separate unit to the windscreen glass

LOSS.description: Glass damage

INDEMNITY.description: Replace what is lost or damaged

description: I was approached by someone claiming to be a mechanic who offered to inspect my car for free. He seemed knowledgeable and convincing, so I allowed him to take a look. He pointed out that my brake pads and a few other spare parts needed immediate replacement. Trusting his expertise, I agreed to let him handle the repairs. He took the parts with him, promising to return with new ones. However, he never came back, and I realized I had been deceived. Is there any recourse available for such deceptive practices under my current policy?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:

Loss or theft of your car by deception. This includes, but is not limited to: Loss or theft as a result of handing the keys of your car over to someone who claims to be a buyer or agent without taking precautions to ensure your car is returned to you. An example of an acceptable precaution is to attend the test drive with the prospective buyer. Loss or theft as a result of someone purchasing your car using a payment method which does not result in you receiving the payment for your car.

LOSS.description: Loss or theft of your car by deception.

RISK_EVENT.description: Any occurrence that may lead to harm or loss of a car, as specified in a car insurance policy.

The impact caused significant damage, requiring immediate repairs. After the repairs, I noticed a loss of value due to the visible difference in the paintwork compared to the original finish. Is there any potential for coverage reconsideration given the circumstances of the incident?

The spare parts I have are covered under my policy, but I need to address the tyre damage, which isn't covered unless it results from an accident. Could the circumstances of this incident be considered an accident for coverage purposes?

description: While driving to work, I noticed a strange noise coming from the engine. Suddenly, the car started losing power and eventually stalled in the middle of the road. I managed to pull over safely to the side. After inspecting the car, I realized there was a mechanical failure in the transmission system. This resulted in a loss of use, as I couldn't drive the car any further and had to arrange for it to be towed to the nearest repair shop. Could there be any potential coverage for mechanical failures that result in loss of use?

sources.paragraph: You are not covered for the following:
Loss of use, loss of value, wear and tear, mechanical or electrical failure, breakdowns or breakages.
